episodes.name: Day One
episodes.overview: An inside look at day one on the set of Better Call Saul!

episodes.name: Music Video
episodes.overview: Check out the music video for Better Call Saul!

episodes.name: In the Studio
episodes.overview: A very rare inside-the-studio look at the creation of the song "Better Call Saul," performed by Junior Brown and written by the show creators Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould.

episodes.name: Characters of Better Call Saul
episodes.overview: The cast and crew introduce the characters of the new series.

episodes.name: No Picnic
episodes.overview: A family settles in for a picnic on the side of a dirty highway...with an ulterior motive.

episodes.name: American Greed: James McGill
episodes.overview: Mockumentary done in the style of the documentary series American Greed.  Featuring in-character interviews of several recurring Better Call Saul cast members recounting their memories of Jimmy McGill and Kim Wexler.

episodes.name: How to Make a Taco
episodes.overview: Even making a meal feels dangerous when Lalo Salamanca is in the kitchen. Better Call Saul Season 5 premieres Sunday, February 23 at 10/9c.

episodes.name: How to Iron a Shirt
episodes.overview: Gustavo Fring will teach you how to look sharp – razor sharp.

episodes.name: How to Negotiate
episodes.overview: Negotiation is a process. Learn how to master it from Kim Wexler.

episodes.name: How to Make a Pimento Cheese Sandwich
episodes.overview: Mike Ehrmantraut shares the basics of how to prepare an easy lunch.

episodes.name: How to Get Out of Jury Duty
episodes.overview: There's no greater duty than participating in democratic government through jury service, but Saul Goodman has plenty of tips to help you avoid it when it's inconvenient.

episodes.name: How to Spot Counterfeit Money
episodes.overview: Nacho knows money and he’s going to teach you how to tell the real bills from the fake ones.

episodes.name: How to Ace an Interview
episodes.overview: Howard Hamlin give you the tools to make an excellent first impression.

episodes.name: How to Do Your Job as a Juror
episodes.overview: Saul, Howard and Kim break down the ins and outs of sitting on a jury.

episodes.name: How to Tie a Tie
episodes.overview: Don't miss the premiere Sunday, February 23 at 10/9c.

episodes.name: How To Find Jupiter With a Telescope
episodes.overview: What CAN’T Mike (Jonathan Banks) do?

episodes.name: How To Make Friends With Anyone
episodes.overview: All you need is confidence and a winning smile with Lalo (Tony Dalton).

episodes.name: How to Throw A Punch
episodes.overview: Howard Hamlin (Patrick Fabian) gives a step-by-step tutorial on how to throw a punch. Put your hips into it...

episodes.name: How to Manage Threatening Clients
episodes.overview: Learning from Kim (Rhea Seehorn) is an honor.

episodes.name: Box Set
episodes.overview: For the low, low price of $19.99, you too can become an expert in the art of the scheme!

episodes.name: Stories from the Set: Season 6
episodes.overview: Bob Odenkirk (Saul) and Patrick Fabian (Howard) break down their boxing scene.

episodes.name: Series Recap
episodes.overview: Before the final episodes, a quick recap of the series so far.

episodes.overview: The bad guys of Breaking Bad & Better Call Saul.

episodes.name: Jimmy and Kim a Complicated Relationship
episodes.overview: Jimmy McGill & Kim Wexler's up and down relationship.

episodes.name: Landing Fifi
episodes.overview: The initial long-one-shot sequence is directly inspired by the initial sequence of "Touch of evil" by Orson Wells which is also set in the Mexico-US border and it's one of the most iconic initial sequences in the history of cinema.

episodes.overview: Original Music by Composer Dave Porter

episodes.overview: Don't mess with Kim Wexler.

episodes.overview: Mike Ehrmantraut offers a few easy ways to take responsibility for keeping strangers and criminals out of your business.

Tell Me Again
episodes.overview: Short featurettes where the cast and crew discuss key scenes and character arcs from the season. These segments delve into the motivations and decisions of the characters as the story unfolds.

episodes.name: The Good, The Bags, and The Ugly
episodes.overview: This feature focuses on the episode "Bagman," highlighting the challenges and behind-the-scenes details of shooting in the desert.

episodes.name: The Ambush
episodes.overview: An exploration of the intense ambush scene, discussing the choreography, special effects, and performances that made it stand out.

episodes.name: The Effects for This!
episodes.overview: A look at the special effects used in Season 5, from practical effects to digital enhancements, and how they contribute to the show's realism.

episodes.name: Gag Reel: season 5
episodes.overview: A collection of humorous outtakes and bloopers from the filming of Season 5.

episodes.name: Ethics Training with Kim Wexler
episodes.overview: A tongue-in-cheek legal ethics seminar led by Kim Wexler (Rhea Seehorn), blending character insight with real legal principles, providing an engaging and informative look at the character's professional world.

episodes.name: Crystal Balls
episodes.overview: his featurette explores the themes of fate and foresight in "Better Call Saul," with cast and crew discussing how the series foreshadows events and character arcs that connect with the larger "Breaking Bad" universe.

episodes.name: Fear and Loathing In Omaha – The World of Gene Takavic
episodes.overview: 15-minute feature exploring Gene's storyline and its development in the final season.

episodes.name: Series Adjourned – Saying Goodbye to Saul
episodes.overview: A 25-minute reflection with the cast and creative team, focusing on the final season and providing behind-the-scenes insights.

episodes.name: Wine and Roses - Casa Goodman
episodes.overview: A 29-minute featurette that delves into the opening scenes of the season, examining the details of Saul's house post-"Breaking Bad" events, with insights from director Michael Morris.

episodes.name: Gag Reel: season 2
episodes.overview: A collection of humorous outtakes and bloopers from the filming of Season 2.

episodes.name: Gag Reel: season 3
episodes.overview: A collection of humorous outtakes and bloopers from the filming of Season 3.

episodes.name: Gag Reel: season 4
episodes.overview: A collection of humorous outtakes and bloopers from the filming of Season 4.

episodes.name: Gag Reel: season 6
episodes.overview: A collection of humorous outtakes and bloopers from the filming of Season 6.

episodes.name: Los Pollos Hermanos Training Videos
episodes.overview: A series of mock employee training videos for the fictional Los Pollos Hermanos restaurant, presented by Gus Fring.

episodes.name: Creating the First Season
episodes.overview: This featurette covers the creative process behind the development of the first season. It includes interviews with creators Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould, along with key cast members, discussing character development and plot creation.

episodes.name: Jimmy in the Courtroom
episodes.overview: A short feature that provides a closer look at one of the courtroom scenes from the series, with commentary from the actors and director.

episodes.name: Jimmy in the Courtroom
episodes.overview: Focuses on the courtroom scenes and legal aspects of the show, with insights from legal consultants and the cast.

episodes.name: switch - Table read
episodes.overview: Table read of "switch"

episodes.name: Uno
episodes.overview: Jimmy works his magic in the courtroom. Unexpected inspiration leads him to an unconventional pursuit of potential clients.

episodes.name: Mijo
episodes.overview: As his troubles escalate to a boiling point, Jimmy finds himself in dire straits. An act of carelessness puts Chuck at risk.

episodes.name: Nacho
episodes.overview: Jimmy pulls out all the stops to prove that his dangerous client is innocent, even though it causes some friction with Kim.

episodes.name: Hero
episodes.overview: Jimmy conjures up a bold plan to solicit new clients, but has to face the consequences when the scheme strains his relationships with a rival firm.

episodes.name: Alpine Shepherd Boy
episodes.overview: When his efforts to drum up new business are interrupted by alarming news, Jimmy is pressured to make a difficult choice.

episodes.name: Five-O
episodes.overview: Mike's tragic past comes back to haunt him, and he's forced to seek help from an unusual source. Meanwhile, Jimmy's moral compass is put to the test.

episodes.name: Bingo
episodes.overview: Jimmy meets with potential new clients. When given the opportunity to do the right thing, Jimmy cashes in a favor from an unlikely ally.

episodes.name: RICO
episodes.overview: Jimmy shows Chuck that he's willing to do almost anything to win a case, even if it means getting his hands dirty.

episodes.name: Pimento
episodes.overview: Chuck urges Jimmy to accept a harsh truth. Meanwhile, a deal threatens to go off the rails when Mike's ability to complete a job is called into question.

episodes.name: Marco
episodes.overview: In the aftermath of recent events, Jimmy seizes an opportunity to reconnect with an old friend. Chuck adjusts to a new way of life.

episodes.name: Switch
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim's relationship takes a new turn. Mike decides it's for the best to sever his affiliation with an unrestrained associate.

episodes.name: Cobbler
episodes.overview: To keep a potentially messy situation from unraveling, Mike brokers a deal. Jimmy works to exonerate an eccentric client.

episodes.name: Amarillo
episodes.overview: Jimmy's client outreach efforts thrive, and he exhibits new heights of showmanship. Mike is perplexed by daughter-in-law Stacey's troubling news.

episodes.name: Gloves Off
episodes.overview: Jimmy's actions unexpectedly create waves for Kim. Mike cautiously weighs a lucrative proposal that might bring about dire consequences.

episodes.name: Rebecca
episodes.overview: Jimmy becomes frustrated with his restrictive work environment. Kim pulls out all the stops to dig herself out of a seemingly bottomless hole at HHM.

episodes.name: Bali Ha'i
episodes.overview: Jimmy finds comfort in familiarity; Kim receives a life-changing proposal; when he is threatened, Mike finds himself pushed to the limit.

episodes.name: Inflatable
episodes.overview: When Mike's hand is forced, he can no longer hide his frustration; he and Jimmy work together to keep the peace.

episodes.name: Fifi
episodes.overview: Mike aims to settle the score with an enemy; an unexpected opportunity presents itself to Jimmy.

episodes.name: Nailed
episodes.overview: Mike takes a methodical approach to his mission; someone questions Chuck's capabilities; Jimmy faces a personal dilemma.

episodes.name: Klick
episodes.overview: Jimmy must make a hard choice; Mike takes control of matters; Hamlin delivers shocking news.

episodes.name: Mabel
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Chuck's relationship deteriorates. Kim feels the pressure of running her own firm. Mike investigates the note left on his car.

episodes.name: Witness
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim hire an assistant. Mike seeks out a mysterious acquaintance. Chuck uses the law to gain an advantage over Jimmy.

episodes.name: Sunk Costs
episodes.overview: Jimmy decides to represent a new client to Kim's dismay. Mike meets a formidable ally who gives a most tempting offer.

episodes.name: Sabrosito
episodes.overview: Jimmy asks a favor of Mike. New complications disrupt Salamancas' business. Chuck and Jimmy struggle with a compromise.

episodes.name: Chicanery
episodes.overview: Kim and Jimmy face off with an adversary. Jimmy looks to Chuck's past to secure his future. Jimmy loses an ally and gains another.

episodes.name: Off Brand
episodes.overview: Jimmy has a new endeavor. Chuck pushes himself to the limit. Nacho finds himself in a power struggle.

episodes.name: Expenses
episodes.overview: Jimmy tries to settle debts. Nacho reunites with an acquaintance. Mike helps Stacey with a project and makes a connection.

episodes.name: Slip
episodes.overview: Jimmy is pushed to desperate measures. Nacho picks up a skill. Mike explores an alliance. Kim stands up to Hamlin.

episodes.name: Fall
episodes.overview: Jimmy visits a friend and takes up an old pastime. Chuck and Hamlin argue over the future of the firm. Kim faces challenges.

episodes.name: Lantern
episodes.overview: Kim takes time off. Jimmy tries to make amends. Nacho gambles with his future. Hamlin pushes Chuck to make a decision.

episodes.name: Smoke
episodes.overview: Jimmy struggles to cope with Chuck's tragic death; Mike ponders his role at Madrigal; Howard makes a startling confession.

episodes.name: Breathe
episodes.overview: Jimmy seeks new employment; Gus navigates the fallout from Hector's collapse; Kim endeavors to support Jimmy in the wake of Chuck's death.

episodes.name: Something Beautiful
episodes.overview: Jimmy puts a risky plan into motion; as alliances shift, Nacho finds himself in the crosshairs; Kim contemplates her future.

episodes.name: Talk
episodes.overview: A restless Jimmy embarks on a new endeavor while Mike burns bridges; Kim pursues her bliss; Nacho tries to survive a turf war.

episodes.name: Quite a Ride
episodes.overview: Jimmy identifies a new market for his talents; Mike vets a potential partnership; Kim drives a hard bargain.

episodes.name: Piñata
episodes.overview: While Jimmy daydreams about reconstituting Wexler-McGill, Kim sets out to secure her own future; Mike puts a plan into motion for Gus.

episodes.name: Something Stupid
episodes.overview: Jimmy expands his business, but runs into a problem that only Kim can solve; Gus intervenes in Hector's medical care; Mike deals with a setback.

episodes.name: Coushatta
episodes.overview: Jimmy goes to great lengths to right a wrong, as Kim pulls out all the stops for a case; Mike lets his team blow off steam; Nacho receives a visitor.

episodes.name: Wiedersehen
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim unburden themselves, risking their relationship in the process; Nacho is forced to make the rounds with Lalo; Mike has cause to worry.

episodes.name: Winner
episodes.overview: Jimmy turns the page on his reputation; Lalo tracks a loose end in Gus' operation; Mike is forced to make a difficult decision.

episodes.name: Magic Man
episodes.overview: Now doing business as Saul Goodman, Jimmy unveils an unorthodox strategy for client development that tests Kim's tolerance of his new legal persona. Lalo searches for the mysterious Michael, only to discover a problem within his own operation.

episodes.name: 50% Off
episodes.overview: Jimmy's promotional stunt has unintended consequences. Nacho takes extreme measures to earn Lalo's trust. Saul is a success at the courthouse but still has yet to win Kim over. Simmering with rage and self-loathing, Mike loses his temper.

episodes.name: The Guy for This
episodes.overview: Jimmy's business enters uncharted territory. Kim's confidence is tested when she's faced with a legal problem only she can solve. Nacho navigates increased pressure from Gus. Mike continues to spiral.

episodes.name: Namaste
episodes.overview: As Jimmy doubles down on Saul Goodman, a deeply conflicted Kim brings him an interesting proposition. Gus makes a sacrifice in order to play the long game. Mike attempts to smooth things over with his family.

episodes.name: Dedicado a Max
episodes.overview: Mike takes an impromptu trip out of town. As she and Jimmy grow closer over their campaign to help a client, Kim makes a surprising call.

episodes.name: Wexler v. Goodman
episodes.overview: Kim tries to pump the brakes on Jimmy's latest scheme, but it may be too late to stop Saul. Mike turns the heat up on Lalo. Nacho attempts to enlist support from above.

episodes.name: JMM
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim build a legal firewall with help from Huell. Kim sets things straight with her clients as Jimmy is compromised by his. Gus calms troubled waters in service of his plot to build an empire. Mike does damage control.

episodes.name: Bagman
episodes.overview: When a simple errand for a client goes sideways, Jimmy is pushed to the limit. Mike takes measures to contain the wrath of the cartel. Lalo gets an unexpected visitor.

episodes.name: Bad Choice Road
episodes.overview: In the wake of Jimmy's traumatic misadventure, Kim takes stock of what is important. Jimmy attempts to return to business as usual, but it's more difficult than anticipated. Gus and Mike set a plan in motion.

episodes.name: Something Unforgivable
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim make a sideways move that takes a serious turn. Nacho gets closer to the cartel.

episodes.name: Wine and Roses
episodes.overview: Nacho runs for his life. Jimmy and Kim hatch a plan. Mike questions his allegiances.

episodes.name: Carrot and Stick
episodes.overview: Harsh realities dawn on Nacho. Gus investigates his suspicions.

episodes.name: Rock and Hard Place
episodes.overview: Still on the run, Nacho is forced to choose where his loyalties lie. Jimmy doubles down.

episodes.name: Hit and Run
episodes.overview: Despite assurances from the cartel, Gus takes extreme measures to protect himself against looming threats; Kim and Jimmy enlist the help of a local pro to put on a show for Cliff Main; Howard seeks outside counsel.

episodes.name: Black and Blue
episodes.overview: While business booms for Jimmy, the vise tightens on the cat-and-mouse game between Gus and Lalo.

episodes.name: Axe and Grind
episodes.overview: Kim and Jimmy enlist a knowledgeable contact; Howard scrutinizes Jimmy's business practices.

episodes.name: Plan and Execution
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Kim deal with a last-minute snag in their plan.

episodes.name: Point and Shoot
episodes.overview: An unexpected visitor forces Jimmy and Kim to face the consequences of their actions.

episodes.name: Fun and Games
episodes.overview: Gus attempts to smooth things over with the cartel while Mike ties up loose ends.

episodes.name: Nippy
episodes.overview: A new player gets in the game.

episodes.name: Breaking Bad
episodes.overview: Emboldened by recent successes, partners throw caution to the wind and escalate their enterprise to new levels.

episodes.name: Waterworks
episodes.overview: The stakes are raised when a discovery is made.

episodes.name: Saul Gone
episodes.overview: Revelations. Regrets. RICO violations. Jimmy's worlds — and identities — converge in one final showdown.
